routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer, num_seg_quarter_circle - Computes a geometry covering all points within a given distance from a geometry.
routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_Buffer($1, $2, CAST('quad_segs='||CAST($3 AS text) as text))

routine.name: st_buildarea(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Creates a polygonal geometry formed by the linework of a geometry.

routine.name: st_centroid(geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: g1, use_spheroid = true - Returns the geometric center of a geometry.

routine.name: st_centroid(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the geometric center of a geometry.

routine.name: st_chaikinsmoothing(geometry, integer DEFAULT 1, boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: geom, nIterations = 1, preserveEndPoints = false - Returns a smoothed version of a geometry, using the Chaikin algorithm

routine.name: st_clipbybox2d(geom geometry, box box2d)
routine.comment: args: geom, box - Computes the portion of a geometry falling within a rectangle.

routine.name: st_closestpoint(geography, geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geom1, geom2, use_spheroid = true - Returns the 2D point on g1 that is closest to g2. This is the first point of the shortest line from one geometry to the other.

routine.name: st_closestpoint(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom1, geom2 - Returns the 2D point on g1 that is closest to g2. This is the first point of the shortest line from one geometry to the other.

routine.name: st_closestpointofapproach(geometry, geometry)
routine.comment: args: track1, track2 - Returns a measure at the closest point of approach of two trajectories.

routine.name: st_clusterdbscan(geometry, eps double precision, minpoints integer)
routine.comment: args: geom, eps, minpoints - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry using the DBSCAN algorithm.

routine.name: st_clusterintersecting(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Aggregate function that clusters input geometries into connected sets.

routine.name: st_clusterintersectingwin(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry, clustering input geometries into connected sets.

routine.name: st_clusterkmeans(geom geometry, k integer, max_radius double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision)
routine.comment: args: geom, number_of_clusters, max_radius - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry using the K-means algorithm.

routine.name: st_clusterwithin(geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g, distance - Aggregate function that clusters geometries by separation distance.

routine.name: st_clusterwithinwin(geometry, distance double precision)
routine.comment: args: geom, distance - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry, clustering using separation distance.

routine.name: st_collect(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Creates a GeometryCollection or Multi* geometry from a set of geometries.

routine.name: st_collect(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1field - Creates a GeometryCollection or Multi* geometry from a set of geometries.

routine.name: st_collect(geometry[])
routine.comment: args: g1_array - Creates a GeometryCollection or Multi* geometry from a set of geometries.

routine.name: st_collectionextract(geometry)
routine.comment: args: collection - Given a geometry collection, returns a multi-geometry containing only elements of a specified type.

routine.name: st_collectionextract(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: collection, type - Given a geometry collection, returns a multi-geometry containing only elements of a specified type.

routine.name: st_collectionhomogenize(geometry)
routine.comment: args: collection - Returns the simplest representation of a geometry collection.

routine.name: st_concavehull(param_geom geometry, param_pctconvex double precision, param_allow_holes boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: param_geom, param_pctconvex, param_allow_holes = false - Computes a possibly concave geometry that contains all input geometry vertices

routine.name: st_convexhull(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Computes the convex hull of a geometry.

routine.name: st_coorddim(geometry geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Return the coordinate dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_coverageinvalidedges(geom geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = 0 - Window function that finds locations where polygons fail to form a valid coverage.

routine.name: st_coveragesimplify(geom geometry, tolerance double precision, simplifyboundary boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance, simplifyBoundary = true - Window function that simplifies the edges of a polygonal coverage.

routine.name: st_coverageunion(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Computes the union of a set of polygons forming a coverage by removing shared edges.

routine.name: st_cpawithin(geometry, geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: track1, track2, dist - Tests if the closest point of approach of two trajectoriesis within the specified distance.

routine.name: st_curvetoline(geom geometry, tol double precision DEFAULT 32, toltype integer DEFAULT 0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: curveGeom, tolerance, tolerance_type, flags - Converts a geometry containing curves to a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_delaunaytriangles(g1 geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: g1, tolerance = 0.0, flags = 0 - Returns the Delaunay triangulation of the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_dfullywithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_difference(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, gridsize double precision DEFAULT '-1.0'::numeric)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, gridSize = -1 - Computes a geometry representing the part of geometry A that does not intersect geometry B.

routine.name: st_dimension(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the topological dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_distance(geog1 geography, geog2 geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geog1, geog2, use_spheroid = true - Returns the distance between two geometry or geography values.

routine.name: st_distance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the distance between two geometry or geography values.

routine.name: st_distancecpa(geometry, geometry)
routine.comment: args: track1, track2 - Returns the distance between the closest point of approach of two trajectories.

routine.name: st_distancesphere(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, radius double precision)
routine.comment: args: geomlonlatA, geomlonlatB, radius=6371008 - Returns minimum distance in meters between two lon/lat geometries using a spherical earth model.

routine.name: st_distancespheroid(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, spheroid)
routine.comment: args: geomlonlatA, geomlonlatB, measurement_spheroid=WGS84 - Returns the minimum distance between two lon/lat geometries using a spheroidal earth model.

routine.name: st_dump(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the components of a geometry.

routine.name: st_dumppoints(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the coordinates in a geometry.

routine.name: st_dumprings(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the exterior and interior rings of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_dumpsegments(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the segments in a geometry.

routine.name: st_dwithin(geog1 geography, geog2 geography, tolerance double precision, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
st_dwithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_endpoint(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the last point of a LineString or CircularLineString.

routine.name: st_envelope(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns a geometry representing the bounding box of a geometry.

routine.name: st_estimatedextent(text, text)
routine.comment: args: table_name, geocolumn_name - Returns the estimated extent of a spatial table.

routine.name: st_estimatedextent(text, text, text)
routine.comment: args: schema_name, table_name, geocolumn_name - Returns the estimated extent of a spatial table.

routine.name: st_estimatedextent(text, text, text, boolean)
routine.comment: args: schema_name, table_name, geocolumn_name, parent_only - Returns the estimated extent of a spatial table.

routine.name: st_expand(box box2d, dx double precision, dy double precision)
routine.comment: args: box, dx, dy - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_expand(box box3d, dx double precision, dy double precision, dz double precision DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: box, dx, dy, dz=0 - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_expand(box2d, double precision)
routine.comment: args: box, units_to_expand - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_expand(box3d, double precision)
routine.comment: args: box, units_to_expand - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_expand(geom geometry, dx double precision, dy double precision, dz double precision DEFAULT 0, dm double precision DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: geom, dx, dy, dz=0, dm=0 - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_expand(geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: geom, units_to_expand - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_extent(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomfield - Aggregate function that returns the bounding box of geometries.

routine.name: st_exteriorring(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns a LineString representing the exterior ring of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_filterbym(geometry, double precision, double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: geom, min, max = null, returnM = false - Removes vertices based on their M value

routine.name: st_findextent(text, text)
st_findextent(text, text, text)
st_flipcoordinates(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a version of a geometry with X and Y axis flipped.

routine.name: st_force2d(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Force the geometries into a "2-dimensional mode".

routine.name: st_force3d(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZ mode. This is an alias for ST_Force3DZ.

routine.name: st_force3dm(geom geometry, mvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geomA, Mvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYM mode.

routine.name: st_force3dz(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZ mode.

routine.name: st_force4d(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0, mvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0, Mvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZM mode.

routine.name: st_forcecollection(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Convert the geometry into a GEOMETRYCOLLECTION.

routine.name: st_forcecurve(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Upcast a geometry into its curved type, if applicable.

routine.name: st_forcepolygonccw(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Orients all exterior rings counter-clockwise and all interior rings clockwise.

routine.name: st_forcepolygoncw(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Orients all exterior rings clockwise and all interior rings counter-clockwise.

routine.name: st_forcerhr(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Force the orientation of the vertices in a polygon to follow the Right-Hand-Rule.

routine.name: st_forcesfs(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Force the geometries to use SFS 1.1 geometry types only.

routine.name: st_forcesfs(geometry, version text)
routine.comment: args: geomA, version - Force the geometries to use SFS 1.1 geometry types only.

routine.name: st_frechetdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision DEFAULT '-1'::integer)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, densifyFrac = -1 - Returns the Fréchet distance between two geometries.

routine.name: st_generatepoints(area geometry, npoints integer)
routine.comment: args: g, npoints - Generates random points contained in a Polygon or MultiPolygon.

routine.name: st_generatepoints(area geometry, npoints integer, seed integer)
routine.comment: args: g, npoints, seed = 0 - Generates random points contained in a Polygon or MultiPolygon.

routine.name: st_geomcollfromtext(text)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromtext(text, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromwkb(bytea)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromwkb(bytea, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geometricmedian(g geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, max_iter integer DEFAULT 10000, fail_if_not_converged boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = NULL, max_iter = 10000, fail_if_not_converged = false - Returns the geometric median of a MultiPoint.

routine.name: st_geometryn(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: geomA, n - Return an element of a geometry collection.

routine.name: st_geometrytype(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the SQL-MM type of a geometry as text.

routine.name: st_hasarc(geometry geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry contains a circular arc

routine.name: st_hausdorffdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the Hausdorff distance between two geometries.

routine.name: st_hausdorffdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, densifyFrac - Returns the Hausdorff distance between two geometries.

routine.name: st_hexagon(size double precision, cell_i integer, cell_j integer, origin geometry DEFAULT '010100000000000000000000000000000000000000'::geometry)
routine.comment: args: size, cell_i, cell_j, origin - Returns a single hexagon, using the provided edge size and cell coordinate within the hexagon grid space.

routine.name: st_hexagongrid(size double precision, bounds geometry, OUT geom geometry, OUT i integer, OUT j integer)
routine.comment: args: size, bounds - Returns a set of hexagons and cell indices that completely cover the bounds of the geometry argument.

routine.name: st_interiorringn(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: a_polygon, n - Returns the Nth interior ring (hole) of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_interpolatepoint(line geometry, point geometry)
routine.comment: args: linear_geom_with_measure, point - Returns the interpolated measure of a geometry closest to a point.

routine.name: st_intersection(geography, geography)
routine.comment: args: geogA, geogB - Computes a geometry representing the shared portion of geometries A and B.

routine.name: st_intersection(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, gridsize double precision DEFAULT '-1'::integer)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, gridSize = -1 - Computes a geometry representing the shared portion of geometries A and B.

routine.name: st_inversetransformpipeline(geom geometry, pipeline text, to_srid integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: geom, pipeline, to_srid - Return a new geometry with coordinates transformed to a different spatial reference system using the inverse of a defined coordinate transformation pipeline.

routine.name: st_isclosed(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a LineStringss start and end points are coincident. For a PolyhedralSurface tests if it is closed (volumetric).

routine.name: st_iscollection(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a geometry is a geometry collection type.

routine.name: st_isempty(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry is empty.

routine.name: st_ispolygonccw(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Tests if Polygons have exterior rings oriented counter-clockwise and interior rings oriented clockwise.

routine.name: st_ispolygoncw(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Tests if Polygons have exterior rings oriented clockwise and interior rings oriented counter-clockwise.

routine.name: st_isring(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a LineString is closed and simple.

routine.name: st_issimple(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry has no points of self-intersection or self-tangency.

routine.name: st_isvalid(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a geometry is well-formed in 2D.

routine.name: st_isvalid(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: g, flags - Tests if a geometry is well-formed in 2D.

routine.name: st_isvaliddetail(geom geometry, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: geom, flags - Returns a valid_detail row stating if a geometry is valid or if not a reason and a location.

routine.name: st_isvalidreason(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns text stating if a geometry is valid, or a reason for invalidity.

routine.name: st_isvalidreason(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: geomA, flags - Returns text stating if a geometry is valid, or a reason for invalidity.

routine.name: st_isvalidtrajectory(geometry)
routine.comment: args: line - Tests if the geometry is a valid trajectory.

routine.name: st_largestemptycircle(geom geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, boundary geometry DEFAULT '0101000000000000000000F87F000000000000F87F'::geometry, OUT center geometry, OUT nearest geometry, OUT radius double precision)
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance=0.0, boundary=POINT EMPTY - Computes the largest circle not overlapping a geometry.

routine.name: st_length(geog geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geog, use_spheroid = true - Returns the 2D length of a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_length(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_2dlinestring - Returns the 2D length of a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_length2d(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_2dlinestring - Returns the 2D length of a linear geometry. Alias for ST_Length

routine.name: st_lengthspheroid(geometry, spheroid)
routine.comment: args: a_geometry, a_spheroid - Returns the 2D or 3D length/perimeter of a lon/lat geometry on a spheroid.

IF font IS NULL THEN font := font_default; END IF;
-- For character spacing, use m as guide size geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>'m', 'base64')); m_width := ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom); spacing := m_width / 12;
letterarray := regexp_split_to_array(replace(letters, ' ', E'\t'), E''); FOREACH letter IN ARRAY letterarray LOOP geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>(letter), 'base64')); -- Chars are not already zeroed out, so do it now geom := ST_Translate(geom, -1 * ST_XMin(geom), 0.0); -- unknown characters are treated as spaces IF geom IS NULL THEN -- spaces are a "quarter m" in width width := m_width / 3.5; ELSE width := (ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom)); END IF; geom := ST_Translate(geom, position, 0.0); -- Tighten up spacing when characters have a large gap -- between them like Yo or To adjustment := 0.0; IF prevgeom IS NOT NULL AND geom IS NOT NULL THEN dist = ST_Distance(prevgeom, geom); IF dist > spacing THEN adjustment = spacing - dist; geom := ST_Translate(geom, adjustment, 0.0); END IF; END IF; prevgeom := geom; position := position + width + spacing + adjustment; wordarr := array_append(wordarr, geom); END LOOP; -- apply the start point and scaling options wordgeom := ST_CollectionExtract(ST_Collect(wordarr)); wordgeom := ST_Scale(wordgeom, text_height/font_default_height, text_height/font_default_height); return wordgeom; END;
